description: College-level calculus-based electromagnetism problems with advanced mathematical techniques. Master electric and magnetic fields, circuits, and electromagnetic induction through rigorous problem-solving and prepare for the AP Physics C: E&M exam.

topics.name: Unit 1: Electrostatics
topics.description: Coulomb's law, electric fields using calculus, Gauss's law with surface integrals, electric potential by line integrals, gradient of potential, and electrostatic energy

topics.name: Unit 2: Conductors, Capacitors & Dielectrics
topics.description: Conductors in electrostatic equilibrium, capacitance derivations, energy stored in capacitors, dielectric materials, boundary conditions, and capacitor networks

topics.name: Unit 3: Electric Circuits
topics.description: Kirchhoff's laws, RC circuits with differential equations, transient analysis, steady-state DC circuits, power dissipation, and multi-loop circuit analysis

topics.name: Unit 4: Magnetic Fields
topics.description: Biot-Savart law with integration, Amp√®re's law with line integrals, magnetic force on charges and currents, magnetic dipole moments, and torque on current loops

topics.name: Unit 5: Electromagnetism
topics.description: Faraday's law of induction, Lenz's law, motional EMF, inductance calculations, RL circuits with differential equations, LC and RLC circuits, energy in magnetic fields, and Maxwell's equations introduction

topics.name: Unit 6: Revision & Exam Prep
topics.description: Comprehensive multi-concept problems, AP-style free response questions, advanced derivations, Maxwell's equations applications, and exam strategies
